Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (49.47%) toAntiviral lectin scytovirin (SVN)G: 17%, S: 15%, N: 13%.Chemical modification: two S-S bonds.Activity: inhibited HIV-1 (EC50 7.6 nM).MOA:virus:  SD1 appears to bind gp120- and gp41 similar to intact SVN.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: pET32c(+) vector, fused with thioredoxin, His-tag, enterokinase digestion. Yield: 2.5 mg/L.
Literature Information.Author: Xiong C, O'Keefe BR, Byrd RA, McMahon JB.2006
Literature Information.Title: Potent anti-HIV activity of scytovirin domain 1 peptide.
